channel.title: [ZIP]Status checker that dosn't need mysql[/ZIP]
channel.description: [ZIP]Status checker that dosn't need mysql[/ZIP] Hey guys, I've just spent 10 mins trying to make a status checker that dosn't require mysql for adding a server, and I am now done. It is attached. All you need to do is download, extract, upload. It doesnt need to run any install scripts or mysql usernames and passes.

item.title: [ZIP]Status checker that dosn't need mysql[/ZIP]
item.dc:creator: @ThuGie ThuGie
item.description:
@ThuGie wrote:

to me it looks like you only spend about 3 minutes or less on it :/.
but as long as it works nobody has a reason to complain.
just put up a note that they might have to chmod the file with the servers.

you could also use something like this

<?
//just replace space with %20 and back and stuff ;).
$source = fopen('servers.dta','r');
flock($source, LOCK_EX) ;
while ($info = fscanf ($source, "%s %d %s\n")){
list ($host,$port,$servername) = $info;
}
flock($source, LOCK_UN);
fclose($source);
?>

havent tested it but its a example :p.
i rather not store anything in flat files unless its some data i need to cache on big websites it helps alot :).
like website’s that show there website stats like how many members are registerd how many visits they have.
its smart to cache that to a file every 30 or so minutes instead regetting them from a database.
you could just store the value in a database but on a big website every query counts so :p…

Read full topic
